snippet: For Web sites that depend on their ranking in search results, Google’s secret — and frequently fluctuating — search algorithm can evoke a complex blend of admiration and fear.
abstract: Google's secret and frequently fluctuating search algorithm, for Web sites that depend on their ranking in search results, can evoke a complex blend of admiration and fear; it has 67 percent of United States search market and collects 75 percent of search ad revenue; Federal Trade Commission recommends preparing antitrust suit against Google over whether it uses its search engine to favor its offerings like Google Shopping over rivals.

byline.original: By STEVE LOHR and CLAIRE CAIN MILLER

lead_paragraph: For Web sites that depend on their ranking in search results, Google’s secret — and frequently fluctuating — search algorithm can evoke a complex blend of admiration and fear.

headline.seo: Google Casts a Big Shadow on Smaller Web Sites
headline.main: Google Casts a Big Shadow on Smaller Web Sites
headline.print_headline: Living, and Dying, in Google’s World
